body: Heads up @rclone/support - the "Support Contract" label was applied to this issue.

> When copying to SharePoint, we are seeing this problem with `.xlsx` files:

These are coming from google drive as google docs. We don't know the size of them in advance so they have to be uploaded with the multipart streaming.

I see that you've set `--streaming-upload-cutoff 100Mi` which is a great idea so what should have happened is that they were streamed into memory and uploaded as a single part.

> ```
> 2025/05/07 14:10:06 NOTICE: file.xlsx: Failed to cancel multipart upload: itemNotFound: The upload session was not found (upload failed due to: HTTP error 404 (404 Not Found) returned body: "{\"error\":{\"code\":\"itemNotFound\",\"message\":\"The upload session was not found\"}}")
> ```
> 
> I [notice](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/9d55b2411f4c37c3bb3922b7f1177c91f081a3e7/backend/onedrive/onedrive.go#L2620-L2626) that all uploads are multipart uploads, which I think happens for a file of any non-zero size. The [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/driveitem-createuploadsession?view=graph-rest-1.0#upload-bytes-to-the-upload-session) says this:
> 
> _Using a fragment size that doesn't divide evenly by 320 KiB results in errors committing some files._
> 
> In these cases, the files are smaller than 320 KiB, and the chunk size is the file size, which does not divide evenly by 320 KiB. I can't be sure, but it would seem that files smaller than that threshold should be uploaded outside of the multipart semantics, but I can't find a way to make that happen.

Your last segment is allowed to be less than 320KiB

Looking at the code, we upload all files (except 0 sized files) with multipart upload and have done since 2018 7f744033d8eae0fa916c3207e05cf56d7708fd09 so I don't think this can be the problem.

Here are some edited highlights from the log you sent me uploading `file.xlsx`. I went back to the first time stuff went wrong. The "not found" errors above are from rclone trying to tidy up the failed upload.

Start of upload

```

```

{"error":{"code":"itemNotFound","message":"The upload session was not found"}}
```

So it just looks like Onedrive couldn't find the upload session we just made and rejected the upload to it.

I tried uploading a google doc xlsx to onedrive for business and it worked fine when I tried it, alas.

Some questions

- Does this happen every time for the same .xlsx files? Or does it upload sometimes?
- Does it happen with any other sort of files?
- Can you reproduce on any other sharepoints?

My best guess at the moment would be that this is an eventual consistency problem with sharepoint - maybe the upload sessions are not distributed quick enough to the upload host. Maybe the upload host is overloaded?

@chscott Very plausible :-)

I've implemented the retry on 404 errors idea with a bonus 5s delay if we get that error as that was only a couple of lines of code.

Have a go and see if it helps

[v1.70.0-beta.8730.4f080773d.fix-8545-onedrive-consistency](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8545-onedrive-consistency/v1.70.0-beta.8730.4f080773d.fix-8545-onedrive-consistency/) on branch [fix-8545-onedrive-consistency](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8545-onedrive-consistency) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
Looks like I'm still getting the error on the retries. I've sent a new log.

I sent a new log with low-level retries set to `10`. It looks like we're still getting the error, which to me points to a problem on the Microsoft side. I've asked the customer to open a ticket with Microsoft, but I'm not hopeful we'll get anything useful.

It keeps getting the session retried error and retrying. So the logic is working but it didn't fix the problem :-(

I managed to dredge out of the archives [why we took away the upload cutoff](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/1716) in 7f74403

> When uploading to onedrive for business two versions of every file are created. That means that for every 1MB of backups 2MB of storage is used.

I re-added the --onedrive-upload-cutoff with a default of -1 to disable the feature. You could try experimenting with it. It does still create two revisions per upload though. Whether this affects the quota still I'm not sure.

Note also that the [maximum size for a single part upload is 4MB](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/rest-api/api/driveitem_put_content?view=odsp-graph-online) .

~~[v1.70.0-beta.8738.104aa979e.fix-8545-onedrive-consistency](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8545-onedrive-consistency/v1.70.0-beta.8738.104aa979e.fix-8545-onedrive-consistency/) on branch [fix-8545-onedrive-consistency](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8545-onedrive-consistency) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)~~

Updated to check the size range of --onedrive-upload-cutoff

@ncw Should I expect `--streaming-upload-cutoff` to enable `--onedrive-upload-cutoff`? I have that set, but it looks like I'm still getting chunked uploads.

> Should I expect `--streaming-upload-cutoff` to enable `--onedrive-upload-cutoff`? I have that set, but it looks like I'm still getting chunked uploads

No you need to set the flag explicitly, eg `--onedrive-upload-cutoff 4M` is the largest it can be. You'll want to set `--streaming-upload-cutoff` to this size or larger.

For example here is me copying a google doc to onedrive business.

```
$ rclone -vv copy --onedrive-upload-cutoff 4M --streaming-upload-cutoff 4M drive:GDocs/Sheets-copy.xlsx onedriveb:
2025/05/14 11:20:52 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.70.0-beta.8738.339ada4f8.fix-8545-onedrive-consistency" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "copy" "--onedrive-upload-cutoff" "4M" "--streaming-upload-cutoff" "4M" "drive:GDocs/Sheets-copy.xlsx" "onedriveb:"]

Transferred:        8.814 KiB / 8.814 KiB, 100%, 8.814 KiB/s, ETA 0s

I'll try it out, but I find these options confusing. Do I need both `--streaming-upload-cutoff` and `--onedrive-upload-cutoff`set, to the same value? That seems redundant to me. Is that the case for other platforms as well? For example, `--drive-upload-cutoff`?

> I'll try it out, but I find these options confusing. Do I need both `--streaming-upload-cutoff` and `--onedrive-upload-cutoff`set, to the same value?

You want to set `--onedrive-upload-cutoff` to the maximum 4M. You want to set `--streaming-upload-cutoff` to >= 4M for your application.

> That seems redundant to me. Is that the case for other platforms as well? For example, `--drive-upload-cutoff`?

Onedrive doesn't support streaming uploads unlike most of the other providers so rclone will buffer up to `--streaming-upload-cutoff`  in memory then start buffering on disk.

For most providers it is about memory use setting  `--streaming-upload-cutoff`  high uses more memory but it is more efficient with most providers to use the single part upload than the streaming upload.

So the two settings are independent, but for this particular application you want them set as above.

I don't know if this will fix your problem though.

> I don't know if this will fix your problem though.

The latest patch with both `--streaming-upload-cutoff` and `--ondrive-upload-cutoff` set to `4M` worked! I sent a log to the support address just in case there's anything you want to review, but I think we can close this.

Thanks @chscott .

I've merged these fixes to master now which means they will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.70
